task.title: Creating a filesystem for application data backups

taskbody.prereq: This procedure requires a host with one unused primary partition or a remote file server that is compatible with XFS.

context.p: Use this procedure create an XFS filesystem on a primary partition, or to mount a remote filesystem, for application data backups.
context.note: If you are using a primary partition on a local device for backups, ensure that the primary partition for internal services data is not on the same device.

step.cmd: Log in to the target host .
Identify the target primary partition for the filesystem to create, if necessary.
step.info: Skip this step if you are using a remote file server.

step.cmd: Create an XFS filesystem, if necessary.
step.info: Skip this step if you are using a remote file server.
step.stepxmp: Replace Partition with the path of the target primary partition: mkfs -t xfs Partition

step.cmd: Create an entry in the /etc/fstab file.

stepxmp.p: Replace File-System-Specification with one of the following values:

ul.li: the path of the primary partition used in the previous step

step.cmd: Create the mount point for backup data.
Mount the filesystem, and then verify it mounted correctly.
